sysReset.name: sysReset
sysReset.description: Setting the value of this attribute to ON is interpreted as a reset command for the system.

sysSetDefaults.name: sysSetDefaults
sysSetDefaults.description: Setting the value of this attribute to ON will cause the system to set the NVRAM parameters to the factory default values. These values will become active after the next system reset

sysResetCounters.name: sysResetCounters
sysResetCounters.description: Setting the value of this attribute to ON will cause the system to clear the performance counters.

sysTrapEnable.name: sysTrapEnable
sysTrapEnable.description: Setting the value of this attribute to OFF will disable the system from sending TRAPs.

sysTrapCounter.name: sysTrapCounter
sysTrapCounter.description: This attribute counts the total number of traps generated by the device, since initialization.

sysCarrierSense.name: sysCarrierSense
sysCarrierSense.description: This attribute defines the carrier sense absolute threshold

sysDeltaCarrierSense.name: sysDeltaCarrierSense
sysDeltaCarrierSense.description: This attribute defines the carrier sense differential threshold

sysPartialDefaults.name: sysPartialDefaults
sysPartialDefaults.description: Setting the value of this attribute to ON will cause the system to set the partial NVRAM parameters to the factory default values. These values will become active after the next system reset

sysRunFromNonActiveCode.name: sysRunFromNonActiveCode
sysRunFromNonActiveCode.description: This attribute make you run from non active code. Automatic switch is done if the non active code is valid. To activate set to On. If the switch succeed no response will be sent to the SNMP browser.

sysNoiseFloor.name: sysNoiseFloor
sysNoiseFloor.description: This attribute defines the low RSSI threshold in DBM units. Allowed range is from -120 to -50 dbm.

sysExternalAmplifier.name: sysExternalAmplifier
sysExternalAmplifier.description: This attribute is set to 1 when external amplifier is connected to the device and set to 0 when device is connected to anntena.

sysDisplayAccessRights.name: sysDisplayAccessRights
sysDisplayAccessRights.description: This attribute Display the access rights of that station.

sysChangeRightsToUSER.name: sysChangeRightsToUSER
sysChangeRightsToUSER.description: This attribute let you change the access rights of that station to USER.

sysChangeRightsToINSTALLER.name: sysChangeRightsToINSTALLER
sysChangeRightsToINSTALLER.description: This attribute let you change the access rights of that station to INSTALLER. Type the Installer password for the desired access right.

sysChangeRightsToTECHNICIAN.name: sysChangeRightsToTECHNICIAN
sysChangeRightsToTECHNICIAN.description: This attribute let you change the access rights of that station to AUTHORIZED TECHNICIAN. Type the Technician password for the desired access right.

sysChangeInstallerPassword.name: sysChangeInstallerPassword
sysChangeInstallerPassword.description: This attribute let you change the Installer Password of that station. Type the new password, maximum 8 characters.

brzHWMacAddress.name: brzHWMacAddress
brzHWMacAddress.description: The Hardware MAC address of the device.

brzApplTunneling.name: brzApplTunneling
brzApplTunneling.description: This attribute specifies the device tunneling mode, as follows: ipx - The device will enable IPX tunneling only. apple-talk - The device will enable AppleTalk tunneling only. none - The device will disable tunneling. both - The device will enable only IPX and AppleTalk tunneling.

brzPositiveBrg.name: brzPositiveBrg
brzPositiveBrg.description: This attribute specifies the Wired to Wireless LAN bridging mode at the AP, as follows: reject-unknown - The AP forwards to the Wireless LAN only frames that are destined to associated stations. forward-unknown - The AP forwards to the Wireless LAN frames destined to associated AND unknown addresses. This value should be used only for Wireless Bridge installations. intelligent - If connected to a wireless bridge, the AP automatically activates the Forward-Unknown option. na - A not applicable value, for non-AP devices.

brzIpFilter.name: brzIpFilter
brzIpFilter.description: Setting the value of this attribute to ON will cause the system to filter all non-IP traffic to the Wireless LAN. This should be used on environments where only IP (and ARP) traffic is permitted.

brzTranslationMode.name: brzTranslationMode
brzTranslationMode.description: When this attribute is set to ON, data frames are being translated for the Wireless LAN transmission. If it is set to OFF, tunneling of data frames apply. All devices within the same Wireless LAN network, must have the same Translation Mode assigned.

brzWIXSupport.name: brzWIXSupport
brzWIXSupport.description: This attribute applies to installations with collocated APs. When it is set to ON, a load balancing algorithm is activated, resulting with balanced Basic Service Sets (cells). This option may be set only at some of the stations in the network.

brzWlanNetID.name: brzWlanNetID
brzWlanNetID.description: This attribute identifies the Wireless LAN network name (Extended Service Set ID) for that device. Stations are not allowed to associate to APs with different Net IDs.

brzAuthenticationType.name: brzAuthenticationType
brzAuthenticationType.description: This attribute indicates the authentication algorithm used during the authentication sequence. The value of this attribute is one of the following: 1 - Open System, 2 - Shared Key, 20 - Special Authentication Algorithm (#0), 21 - Special Authentication Algorithm (#1), 22 - Special Authentication Algorithm (#2).

brzWlanRTNetID.name: brzWlanRTNetID
brzWlanRTNetID.description: This attribute identifies the run-time Wireless LAN network name (Extended Service Set ID) for that device. Stations are not allowed to associate to APs with different Net IDs.

brzApRedundancySupport.name: brzApRedundancySupport
brzApRedundancySupport.description: Setting the value of this attribute to ON will cause the Access-Point to discontinue sending beacons to the Wireless LAN after no multicast or unicast frames for the cell arrive from the Ethernet during a period of 100 seconds. This option is available ONLY on AP (na value assigned in non-AP devices).

brzWlanRelayUnicast.name: brzWlanRelayUnicast
brzWlanRelayUnicast.description: This attribute enables the relaying of unicast frames on the WLAN within the BSS. Setting this attribute to OFF means that unicast frames received from the WLAN by the AP can only be passed to the Distribution System. Applicable only in AP's.

brzWlanRelayBroadcast.name: brzWlanRelayBroadcast
brzWlanRelayBroadcast.description: This attribute enables the relaying of broadcast frames on the WLAN within the BSS. Setting this attribute to OFF means that broadcast frames received from the WLAN by the AP can only be passed to the Distribution System. Applicable only in AP's.

brzApRedundancyLimit.name: brzApRedundancyLimit
brzApRedundancyLimit.description: This attribute sets the time until an Access-Point discontinues sending beacons to the Wireless LAN when no multicast or unicast frames for the cell arrive from the Ethernet. This option is available ONLY on AP (na value assigned in non-AP devices).

brzStaNumForLargeCW.name: brzStaNumForLargeCW
brzStaNumForLargeCW.description: This attribute sets the minimum number of stations in this cell that will cause this unit to use large CW, else this unit will use the default CW. (The value is in the range of 1-120)

brzPowerMngMode.name: brzPowerMngMode
brzPowerMngMode.description: This attribute describes the current power management mode of the station. The allowed values are ACTIVE (for normal mode of operation), and POWER SAVE. An STA will always return an ACTIVE value.

brzACKDelayed.name: brzACKDelayed
brzACKDelayed.description: This attribute applies to installations with collocated APs. When it is set to ON, a load balancing algorithm is activated, resulting with balanced Basic Service Sets (cells). This option may be set only at some of the stations in the network.

brzDTIMPperiod.name: brzDTIMPperiod
brzDTIMPperiod.description: This attribute defines the rate of DTIM frames. The value is expressed in Beacon Intervals. This attribute is applicable only in AP's.

brzPowerMngBitTestMode.name: brzPowerMngBitTestMode
brzPowerMngBitTestMode.description: This attribute describes the current power management bit test mode of the AP. The allowed values are DISABLED (for normal mode of operation), and ENABLED.

brzBeaconInterval.name: brzBeaconInterval
brzBeaconInterval.description: This attribute defines the rate of Beacon frames. The value is expressed in Dwells. This attribute is applicable only in AP's.

brzPowerSaveSupport.name: brzPowerSaveSupport
brzPowerSaveSupport.description: This attribute defines the power save support. 0 - Power Save support disabled 1 - Power Save support enabled 2 - Enable Power Save support with PM bit test This attribute is applicable only in AP's.

brzWlanAssocAge.name: brzWlanAssocAge
brzWlanAssocAge.description: This attribute defines the Association Aging Period.

brzEnableVoice.name: brzEnableVoice
brzEnableVoice.description: This attribute Enables voice priority over other transmissions. This attribute is applicable only in AP's.

brzNonActiveCodeState.name: brzNonActiveCodeState
brzNonActiveCodeState.description: This attribute displays the current non active code state. WARNING: Activate this attribute will cause substantial degradation in station throughput, also answer is delayed!!!

brzDisplayNonActiveCodeVersion.name: brzDisplayNonActiveCodeVersion
brzDisplayNonActiveCodeVersion.description: This attribute displays the active code version and the non active code version.

brzIntelligentBridgingPeriod.name: brzIntelligentBridgingPeriod
brzIntelligentBridgingPeriod.description: This attribute defines the Intelligent Bridging Period in seconds.

trapHostsEntry.name: trapHostsEntry
trapHostsEntry.description: A trap-receiving host entry, containing trap-host objects for a particular host.

trapHostsIndex.name: trapHostsIndex
trapHostsIndex.description: A unique value for each trap-host. Its value ranges between 1 and 3

trapIPaddress.name: trapIPaddress
trapIPaddress.description: The IP address of the host to be sent all traps

trapCommunity.name: trapCommunity
trapCommunity.description: The community of the host to be sent all traps

ipAddr.name: ipAddr
ipAddr.description: The IP address of this device, used to access the device through any of its LAN Ports (Ethernet or WLAN).

maskIP.name: maskIP
maskIP.description: The IP Network mask used by the IP entity when accessing devices through any of its LAN Ports (Ethernet or WLAN).

readCommunity.name: readCommunity
readCommunity.description: The device read community. If updated, it will be used after the next reset.

writeCommunity.name: writeCommunity
writeCommunity.description: The device write community. If updated, it will be used after the next reset.

brzIPStack.name: brzIPStack
brzIPStack.description: This attribute defines whether to use IP stack or not.

brzMaxRate.name: brzMaxRate
brzMaxRate.description: This attribute indicates the rate (in Mbits per second) at which data will be transmitted across the medium. The default value of this attribute shall be 3.

brzMobilLvl.name: brzMobilLvl
brzMobilLvl.description: This attribute indicates the expected mobility level of the system. The default value of this attribute is stationary.

brzAvrgRssi.name: brzAvrgRssi
brzAvrgRssi.description: A value representing the average Signal Strength for packets received from the current AP. This attribute is applicable only for a station (An AP will always return a value of 255).

brzWlanProtocol.name: brzWlanProtocol
brzWlanProtocol.description: This attribute specifies the MAC/PHY protocol, utilized by this system. This attribute is not write accessible for regular users.

brzWlanTrapThreashold.name: brzWlanTrapThreashold
brzWlanTrapThreashold.description: This attribute specifies a threshold value, for sending the WlanStatusTRAP. When the Wireless LAN quality drops below (or goes above) this value, a trap will be issued.

brzWlanQuality.name: brzWlanQuality
brzWlanQuality.description: A measure for quality (and noise level) of the Wireless LAN.

knownAPsTable.name: knownAPsTable
knownAPsTable.description: A table of identities of the most recently known Access Points, and their signal quality.

knownAPsEntry.name: knownAPsEntry
knownAPsEntry.description: An entry in the Known APs table.

knownAPsIndex.name: knownAPsIndex
knownAPsIndex.description: A unique value, representing the index of the AP in the Known APs table

knownAPsValue.name: knownAPsValue
knownAPsValue.description: This attributes specifies the address of a recently known AP. The default value of this attribute shall be null (an empty entry).

knownAPsQuality.name: knownAPsQuality
knownAPsQuality.description: This attribute specifies the current reception quality of frames, transmitted by that AP. At a station, a GOOD value indicates that the station can join that AP.

knownAPsAvrgRssi.name: knownAPsAvrgRssi
knownAPsAvrgRssi.description: A value representing the average Signal Strength for packets received from that AP in RSSI units.

knownAPsStatus.name: knownAPsStatus
knownAPsStatus.description: The validity of the current entry, either invalid or valid.

knownAPsLoadStations.name: knownAPsLoadStations
knownAPsLoadStations.description: A value representing the number of stations associated to that AP.

knownAPsGoodBeacons.name: knownAPsGoodBeacons
knownAPsGoodBeacons.description: A value representing the number of beacons received with Strength more then join level from that AP.

knownAPsTotalBeacons.name: knownAPsTotalBeacons
knownAPsTotalBeacons.description: A value representing the total number of beacons (good and bad) received from that AP.

knownAPsAvrgDbm.name: knownAPsAvrgDbm
knownAPsAvrgDbm.description: A value representing the average Signal Strength for packets received from that AP in DBN units.

brzLastBeacon.name: brzLastBeacon
brzLastBeacon.description: A value representing last dwell to receive beacon from that AP.

brzBadBeacons.name: brzBadBeacons
brzBadBeacons.description: A value representing the number of beacons received with Strength less then join level from that AP.

brzLoadStations.name: brzLoadStations
brzLoadStations.description: A value representing the number of stations associated to that AP.

brzAvrgDBm.name: brzAvrgDBm
brzAvrgDBm.description: A value representing the average Signal Strength for packets received from the current AP. This attribute is applicable only for a station (An AP will always return a value of -255).

bssNumOfStations.name: bssNumOfStations
bssNumOfStations.description: This attribute specifies the number of devices, that are currently associated with this AP.

bssNumOfStationsPeak.name: bssNumOfStationsPeak
bssNumOfStationsPeak.description: This attribute contains the maximum value that bssNumOfStations has reached.

bssCollectPerStationInfo.name: bssCollectPerStationInfo
bssCollectPerStationInfo.description: When this attribute is set to ON, the AP accumulates Wireless Link statistics per each station. This option is available only for the AP. At stations it is always assigned with na (Not Applicable) value. WARNING: Setting this attribute to ON can cause substantial degradation in cell throughput!!!

bssNumOfBeaconSent.name: bssNumOfBeaconSent
bssNumOfBeaconSent.description: This attribute contains the total beacons sent counter.

bssNumOfBeaconLost.name: bssNumOfBeaconLost
bssNumOfBeaconLost.description: This attribute contains the total beacons lost counter.

bssNumOfStationsAuthenticated.name: bssNumOfStationsAuthenticated
bssNumOfStationsAuthenticated.description: This attribute specifies the number of devices, that are currently Authenticated with this AP.

bssNumOfStationsAuthenticatedPeak.name: bssNumOfStationsAuthenticatedPeak
bssNumOfStationsAuthenticatedPeak.description: This attribute contains the maximum value that bssNumOfStationsAuthenticated has reached.

adbTable.name: adbTable
adbTable.description: A table of the stations associated.

stAddress.name: stAddress
stAddress.description: The MAC Address of the station represented by this entry in the Association Data Base

stCFMode.name: stCFMode
stCFMode.description: This attribute is set to ON if the station is in the Contention Free Polling list of the AP.

stMaxRate.name: stMaxRate
stMaxRate.description: This attribute indicates the maximum rate (in Mbits per second) at which that station transmits data across the Wireless medium.

stCurTxRate.name: stCurTxRate
stCurTxRate.description: The rate currently used by the AP to transmit packets to this station

stRssi.name: stRssi
stRssi.description: A value representing the average Signal Strength for packets received from that station in RSSI units. This attribute is being updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stPMMode.name: stPMMode
stPMMode.description: The current Power Management mode of this station Power saving mode enables WLAN units (such as laptops or hand-held devices) to conserve battery power. To enable this feature, first enable power saving for the AP, and then enable power saving in the SA-PCR Card.

stTxFragments.name: stTxFragments
stTxFragments.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments (including retransmissions), that were transmitted to that station over the Wireless LAN. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stTxFragments1M.name: stTxFragments1M
stTxFragments1M.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments (including retransmissions), that were transmitted to that station over the Wireless LAN in 1Mbps. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stTxFragments2M.name: stTxFragments2M
stTxFragments2M.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments (including retransmissions), that were transmitted to that station over the Wireless LAN in 2Mbps. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stTxFragments3M.name: stTxFragments3M
stTxFragments3M.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments (including retransmissions), that were transmitted to that station over the Wireless LAN in 3Mbps. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stTxRetry.name: stTxRetry
stTxRetry.description: This attribute counts the total number of retransmissions to that station, over the Wireless LAN. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stTxDroppedPackets.name: stTxDroppedPackets
stTxDroppedPackets.description: This attribute counts the number of transmit frames (data or management) to this station, that were dropped because of too many retransmissions. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stRxFragments.name: stRxFragments
stRxFragments.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments (data and management) that have been received successfully from that station, through the Wireless LAN. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stWlanStatus.name: stWlanStatus
stWlanStatus.description: This attribute specifies the current reception quality of frames, transmitted by that station.

stResetCounters.name: stResetCounters
stResetCounters.description: Setting the value of this attribute to ON, will clear the station counters at the AP (clear the counters in that adbEntry). Warning: Setting the value of this attribute to ON may cause momentary degradation in performance

stType.name: stType
stType.description: This attribute identifies the device type of the station.

stTxRetryPercent.name: stTxRetryPercent
stTxRetryPercent.description: This attribute calculate the retransmitted percentage, that was retransmitted to that station over the Wireless LAN.

stReTxFragments1M.name: stReTxFragments1M
stReTxFragments1M.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments, that was retransmitted to that station over the Wireless LAN in 1Mbps. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stReTxFragments2M.name: stReTxFragments2M
stReTxFragments2M.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments, that was retransmitted to that station over the Wireless LAN in 2Mbps. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stReTxFragments3M.name: stReTxFragments3M
stReTxFragments3M.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments, that was retransmitted to that station over the Wireless LAN in 2Mbps. It is updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

stDbm.name: stDbm
stDbm.description: A value representing the average Signal Strength for packets received from that station in DBM units. This attribute is being updated only if sysCollectPerStationInfo is set to ON.

brzCurrentAPMacAddress.name: brzCurrentAPMacAddress
brzCurrentAPMacAddress.description: Hardware MAC address of the AP currently associated with. Available ONLY in station.

brzLastAPMacAddress.name: brzLastAPMacAddress
brzLastAPMacAddress.description: The Hardware MAC address of the last AP that the station was associated with. Available ONLY in stations.

brzPreferredAPMacAddress.name: brzPreferredAPMacAddress
brzPreferredAPMacAddress.description: The Hardware MAC address of the preferred AP, to which the station should associate when ever possible. Null value here indicates no preferences. Available ONLY in stations.

brzRoamToAPMacAddress.name: brzRoamToAPMacAddress
brzRoamToAPMacAddress.description: Setting this attribute to a specific AP MAC address, will cause the station to roam immediately to that AP, if possible. Available ONLY for stations.

brzCFMode.name: brzCFMode
brzCFMode.description: This attribute is set to ON if the station required Contention Free services from the AP (hence it is in the AP's Contention Free list). This option is available ONLY on stations. A Not Applicable value is returned for all APs.

brzTx1MBitRate.name: brzTx1MBitRate
brzTx1MBitRate.description: Total transmitted frames in 1 MBit rate.

brzTx2MBitRate.name: brzTx2MBitRate
brzTx2MBitRate.description: Total transmitted frames in 2 MBit rate.

brzTx3MBitRate.name: brzTx3MBitRate
brzTx3MBitRate.description: Total transmitted frames in 3 MBit rate.

brzTotalRetx.name: brzTotalRetx
brzTotalRetx.description: Total Retransmitted frames including all rates.

brzRoamDecisionWin.name: brzRoamDecisionWin
brzRoamDecisionWin.description: This parameter defines a minimum number of RSSI samples which is required to make a decision about the current WLAN channel quality. A new RSSI sample arrives with each incoming frame. Available ONLY in stations.

brzRoamDecisionNumerator.name: brzRoamDecisionNumerator
brzRoamDecisionNumerator.description: This parameter defines a maximum number of RSSI samples that is allowed to be below brzRoamDecisionRSSIThreshold, among a number equal to brzRoamDecisionWin of the last arrived samples. If a number of bad samples (i.e. below brzRoamDecisionRSSIThreshold) exceeds one, which is defined by this parameter, the channel is considered as bad. Available ONLY in stations.

brzRoamDecisionRSSIThreshold.name: brzRoamDecisionRSSIThreshold
brzRoamDecisionRSSIThreshold.description: If an RSSI sample is bellow the value which is defined by this parameter the sample is considered as bad. Available ONLY in stations.

brzJoinDecisionRSSIThreshold.name: brzJoinDecisionRSSIThreshold
brzJoinDecisionRSSIThreshold.description: A station will join a new AP only if the AP transmits with an RSSI quality above the value which is defined by this parameter. Available ONLY in stations. In AP's, this is the threshold for sending Bad WLAN Conditions traps. If a station associated with the AP is heard at an RSII level below this threshold, a Bad WLAN Conditions trap is sent by the AP.

brzNeighboringBeacons.name: brzNeighboringBeacons
brzNeighboringBeacons.description: This parameters defines once in how many dwell times the AP will send a neighboring beacon. Available ONLY in AP's.

brzNumberOfProbeResponses.name: brzNumberOfProbeResponses
brzNumberOfProbeResponses.description: If a number of good RSSI samples coming from a neighbor is greater than or equal to this parameter the neighbor might be selected for joining.

brzNumberOfBeaconsForDisconnect.name: brzNumberOfBeaconsForDisconnect
brzNumberOfBeaconsForDisconnect.description: This parameter defines a maximum number of consecutive not arrived Beacons that is allowed before a disconnect decision. Available ONLY in stations.

brzMaxNumberOfScanning.name: brzMaxNumberOfScanning
brzMaxNumberOfScanning.description: This parameter defines a maximum number of scanning Attempts to perform before system reset. Zero is value for non reset. Available ONLY in stations.

brzNeighboringBeaconRate.name: brzNeighboringBeaconRate
brzNeighboringBeaconRate.description: This parameter defines the Neighboring Beacon Rate in dwells. Zero is value for non Neighboring Beacons. Available ONLY in AP's.

brzRxFromDS.name: brzRxFromDS
brzRxFromDS.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames that have been received successfully from the Wired Distribution system.

brzRxBadFromDS.name: brzRxBadFromDS
brzRxBadFromDS.description: This attribute counts the number errored frames, received from the Wired Distribution system.

brzRxOctetsFromDS.name: brzRxOctetsFromDS
brzRxOctetsFromDS.description: This attribute counts the total number of octets that have been received successfully from the Wired Distribution system.

brzTxToDS.name: brzTxToDS
brzTxToDS.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames that have been transmitted to the Wired Distribution system.

brzMissedFrames.name: brzMissedFrames
brzMissedFrames.description: This attribute counts the total number of missed frames that have missed the transmission to the Ethernet LAN.

brzTxOctetsToDS.name: brzTxOctetsToDS
brzTxOctetsToDS.description: This attribute counts the total number of octets that have been transmitted successfully to the Wired Distribution system.

brzRxOctetsForwardToWlan.name: brzRxOctetsForwardToWlan
brzRxOctetsForwardToWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of octets that have been transmitted successfully to the Wireless LAN.

brzRxForwardToWlan.name: brzRxForwardToWlan
brzRxForwardToWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets that have been transmitted successfully to the Wireless LAN.

brzTxPacketsToWlan.name: brzTxPacketsToWlan
brzTxPacketsToWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames (data and management) that have been transmitted to the Wireless LAN.

brzTxMSDUToWlan.name: brzTxMSDUToWlan
brzTxMSDUToWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames (data frames) that have been transmitted to the Wireless LAN.

brzDiscarded.name: brzDiscarded
brzDiscarded.description: This attribute counts the number of data frames, that were internally discarded in the system, instead of being transmitted over the Wireless LAN. High values of this counter indicate either very high traffic volume, or a noisy environment that prevents Wireless transmissions.

brzTxFragToWlan.name: brzTxFragToWlan
brzTxFragToWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of fragments (data and management) that have been transmitted to the Wireless LAN.

brzRetryOnWlan.name: brzRetryOnWlan
brzRetryOnWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of retransmitted fragments, on the Wireless LAN.

brzFailedCountOnWlan.name: brzFailedCountOnWlan
brzFailedCountOnWlan.description: This attribute counts the number of frames that were dropped (not transmitted), due to the number of retransmits attempts exceeding the RetryMax value.

brzRetryOnWlanPercent.name: brzRetryOnWlanPercent
brzRetryOnWlanPercent.description: This attribute calculates the percentage of number frames (to the data and management) that have been transmitted successfully Wireless LAN.

brzRetryTxDataToWlan.name: brzRetryTxDataToWlan
brzRetryTxDataToWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of data frames that have been retransmitted to the Wireless LAN.

brzRetryTxDataToWlanPercent.name: brzRetryTxDataToWlanPercent
brzRetryTxDataToWlanPercent.description: This attribute calculates the percentage of data frames that have been transmitted successfully to the Wireless LAN.

brzTotalTxPacketsToWlan.name: brzTotalTxPacketsToWlan
brzTotalTxPacketsToWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number frames (data and management) that have been transmitted to the Wireless LAN.

brzTxErrorAckTimeOut.name: brzTxErrorAckTimeOut
brzTxErrorAckTimeOut.description: This attribute counts the total number of acknowledge timeouts on the Wireless LAN.

brzTxErrorAckCRC.name: brzTxErrorAckCRC
brzTxErrorAckCRC.description: This attribute counts the total number of acknowledge CRC Errors on the Wireless LAN.

brzTxErrorNoTimeUntilHop.name: brzTxErrorNoTimeUntilHop
brzTxErrorNoTimeUntilHop.description: This attribute counts the total number of timeouts caused of on time until end of hop on the Wireless Cell.

brzTxErrorUnderRunAndCTS.name: brzTxErrorUnderRunAndCTS
brzTxErrorUnderRunAndCTS.description: This attribute counts the total number of errors caused by HW problems (Under Run).

brzTxErrorAbort.name: brzTxErrorAbort
brzTxErrorAbort.description: This attribute counts the total number of errors caused by frame abortion from Boori.

brzTxErrorFrameReceived.name: brzTxErrorFrameReceived
brzTxErrorFrameReceived.description: This attribute counts the total number of errors caused by frame failure on the Wireless LAN.

brzRxPacketsFromWlan.name: brzRxPacketsFromWlan
brzRxPacketsFromWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames (data and management) that have been received successfully from the Wireless LAN.

brzRxMSDUFromWlan.name: brzRxMSDUFromWlan
brzRxMSDUFromWlan.description: This attribute counts the total number of MSDUs (data frames) that have been received successfully from the Wireless LAN.

brzRxFragFromWlan.name: brzRxFragFromWlan
brzRxFragFromWlan.description: This attribute counts the number of fragments (data and management), that have been received successfully from the Wireless LAN.

brzRxBadFragFromWlan.name: brzRxBadFragFromWlan
brzRxBadFragFromWlan.description: This counter is incremented when an error is detected in a fragment, received from the Wireless LAN.

brzRxDuplicateFragFromWlan.name: brzRxDuplicateFragFromWlan
brzRxDuplicateFragFromWlan.description: This counter is incremented when a duplicated fragment is received from the Wireless LAN.

freqStatisticsTable.name: freqStatisticsTable
freqStatisticsTable.description: A table for the traffic statistics of each frequency.

freqStatisticsEntry.name: freqStatisticsEntry
freqStatisticsEntry.description: An entry in the Frequencies Statistics table.

freqStatisticsIndex.name: freqStatisticsIndex
freqStatisticsIndex.description: A unique value, representing the index of the frequency in the hopping sequence table

freqNo.name: freqNo
freqNo.description: This attributes specifies the channel number of the frequency, for which this entry accumulates the statistics.

freqTotalReceived.name: freqTotalReceived
freqTotalReceived.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames (data and management) that have been received successfully from the Wireless LAN, in that specific frequency.

brzNumOfReassocRequests.name: brzNumOfReassocRequests
brzNumOfReassocRequests.description: For an AP: The number of Associations and ReAssociations requests, received since the last reset of the AP. This counter is useful for getting information about mobility activity on the BSS. For a Station: The number of Associations and ReAssociation requests issued by the station since the last reset.

probeResponseSent.name: probeResponseSent
probeResponseSent.description: For an AP: Number of Probe response that sent.

probeResponseLost.name: probeResponseLost
probeResponseLost.description: For an AP: Number of Probe response that got lost.

probeResponseSentRetx.name: probeResponseSentRetx
probeResponseSentRetx.description: For an AP: Number of retransmitted Probe response frames that sent.

probeRequestRecive.name: probeRequestRecive
probeRequestRecive.description: For an AP: Number of Probe request frames that has received.

assocResponseSent.name: assocResponseSent
assocResponseSent.description: For an AP: Number of Association response frames that sent.

assocResponseLost.name: assocResponseLost
assocResponseLost.description: For an AP: Number of Association response frames that got lost.

assocResponseSentRetx.name: assocResponseSentRetx
assocResponseSentRetx.description: For an AP: Number of retransmitted Association response frames that sent.

assocRequestRecive.name: assocRequestRecive
assocRequestRecive.description: For an AP: Number of Association request frames that has received.

reAssocRequestRecive.name: reAssocRequestRecive
reAssocRequestRecive.description: For an AP: Number of ReAssociation request frames that has received.

probRequestSent.name: probRequestSent
probRequestSent.description: For WB or SA: Number of Probe request frames that sent.

probResponceRecive.name: probResponceRecive
probResponceRecive.description: For WB or SA: Number of received Probe response frames.

authRequestSent.name: authRequestSent
authRequestSent.description: For WB or SA: Number of Authentication request frames that sent.

authRequestSentRetx.name: authRequestSentRetx
authRequestSentRetx.description: For WB or SA: Number of Retransmitted Authentication request frames that sent.

authResponceRecive.name: authResponceRecive
authResponceRecive.description: For WB or SA: Number of received Authentication response frames.

assocRequestSent.name: assocRequestSent
assocRequestSent.description: For WB or SA: Number of Association request frames that sent.

assocRequestSentRetx.name: assocRequestSentRetx
assocRequestSentRetx.description: For WB or SA: Number of Retransmitted Association request frames that sent.

assocResponceRecive.name: assocResponceRecive
assocResponceRecive.description: For WB or SA: Number of received Association response frames.

pSFreeEntries.name: pSFreeEntries
pSFreeEntries.description: For an AP: Number of station free entries.

pSInternallydiscarded.name: pSInternallydiscarded
pSInternallydiscarded.description: For an AP: Number of Internally Discarded frames.

pSstations.name: pSstations
pSstations.description: For an AP: Number of power saved station connected to this AP.

pSPowerSavingAged.name: pSPowerSavingAged
pSPowerSavingAged.description: For an AP: Number of frames that were not transmitted due to the end of aging time.

powreStationsEntry.name: powreStationsEntry
powreStationsEntry.description: A trap-receiving host entry, containing trap-host objects for a particular host.

powerSaveIndex.name: powerSaveIndex
powerSaveIndex.description: A unique value, representing the index of the frequency in the hopping sequence table

powerSaveStationID.name: powerSaveStationID
powerSaveStationID.description: The identifier numerator of the Station in the AP. Note : ID zero is Broadcast.

powerSaveBuffered.name: powerSaveBuffered
powerSaveBuffered.description: This attributes specifies how many messages are waiting to that Station in the AP buffers

powerSaveAged.name: powerSaveAged
powerSaveAged.description: This attributes specifies how many Stations were deleted after long time of waiting

powerSaveSent.name: powerSaveSent
powerSaveSent.description: This attributes specifies how many messages were sent to that station

powerSaveQueueFull.name: powerSaveQueueFull
powerSaveQueueFull.description: This attributes specifies how many messages were discarded because the queue to that station was full

brzTrapAPMacAddr.name: brzTrapAPMacAddr
brzTrapAPMacAddr.description: The MAC address of an AP

brzTrapSTAMacAddr.name: brzTrapSTAMacAddr
brzTrapSTAMacAddr.description: The MAC address of a station device

brzTrapMacAddress.name: brzTrapMacAddress
brzTrapMacAddress.description: A STA or AP MAC address

brzTrapRssiQuality.name: brzTrapRssiQuality
brzTrapRssiQuality.description: The RSSI level of the signal received from the Access Point

brzTrapLastRssiQuality.name: brzTrapLastRssiQuality
brzTrapLastRssiQuality.description: The RSSI level of the signal received from the previous Access Point

brzTrapIndex.name: brzTrapIndex
brzTrapIndex.description: Index number for future trap implementation

brzTrapText.name: brzTrapText
brzTrapText.description: Textual string for future trap implementation

brzTrapToggle.name: brzTrapToggle
brzTrapToggle.description: A general ON/OFF toggle value, for the traps.

brzTrapSTAType.name: brzTrapSTAType
brzTrapSTAType.description: This attribute identifies the device type of the station.

brzAProamingIn.name: brzAProamingIn
brzAProamingIn.description: A trap indicating that a station has roamed into this AP. It contains the MAC address of the associated station and the device type of that station.

brzAPassociated.name: brzAPassociated
brzAPassociated.description: An AP trap indicating that a new station was associated with this AP. It contains the MAC address of the associated station.

brzAPdisassociated.name: brzAPdisassociated
brzAPdisassociated.description: An AP trap indicating that the station dis-associated itself from the AP. The trap contains the MAC address of the disassociated station.

brzAPaging.name: brzAPaging
brzAPaging.description: An AP trap indicating that the station association was aged out, and removed from that AP. The trap contains the MAC address of the aging station

brzAProamedOut.name: brzAProamedOut
brzAProamedOut.description: An AP trap indicating that a given station has roamed out from this AP. The trap contains the MAC address of the roamed out station

brzAPWlanStatusap.name: brzAPWlanStatusap
brzAPWlanStatusap.description: An AP trap, indicating a change in the Wireless media conditions. An ON value is sent when the Wireless LAN quality drops below the brzWlanTrapThreashold value. A trap with an OFF value is sent if the quality improves, exceeding the brzWlanTrapThreashold value. The Wireless LAN quality value is also being sent.

brzWlanStatusOfStation.name: brzWlanStatusOfStation
brzWlanStatusOfStation.description: An AP trap, indicating a change in the quality of the Wireless connection, with a specific (associated) station. An ON value indicates a specially bad connection, and an OFF value is sent if the quality improves, exceeding a predetermined threshold value. The brzTrapMacAddress contains the MAC address of the applicable station.

brzGeneralAP.name: brzGeneralAP
brzGeneralAP.description: An AP general purpose trap, for future trap implementation.

brzWBassociated.name: brzWBassociated
brzWBassociated.description: A WB trap, indicating that the station became associated-with, or has roamed-to, another AP. The trap contains the MAC address and the average RSSI level of the new AP. If the station was roaming, the MAC address of the old AP, and the RSSI level prior to roaming, is also provided (for an association, the second address will appear as all-zeros).

brzWBWlanStatus.name: brzWBWlanStatus
brzWBWlanStatus.description: A WB trap, indicating a change in the Wireless media conditions. An ON value is sent when the Wireless LAN quality drops below the brzWlanTrapThreashold value. A trap with an OFF value is sent if the quality improves, exceeding the brzWlanTrapThreashold value. The Wireless LAN quality value is also being sent.

brzGeneralWB.name: brzGeneralWB
brzGeneralWB.description: A WB general purpose trap, for future trap implementation.

brzSTAassociated.name: brzSTAassociated
brzSTAassociated.description: A station trap, indicating that the station became associated-with, or has roamed-to, another AP. The trap contains the MAC address and the average RSSI level of the new AP. If the station was roaming, the MAC address of the old AP, and the RSSI level prior to roaming, is also provided (for an association, the second address will appear as all-zeros).

brzSTAWlanStatus.name: brzSTAWlanStatus
brzSTAWlanStatus.description: A STA trap, indicating a change in the Wireless media conditions. An ON value is sent when the Wireless LAN quality drops below the brzWlanTrapThreashold value. A trap with an OFF value is sent if the quality improves, exceeding the brzWlanTrapThreashold value. The Wireless LAN quality value is also being sent.

brzGeneralSTA.name: brzGeneralSTA
brzGeneralSTA.description: A STA general purpose trap, for future trap implementation.

brzSA40associated.name: brzSA40associated
brzSA40associated.description: A SA-40 trap, indicating that the station became associated-with, or has roamed-to, another AP. The trap contains the MAC address and the average RSSI level of the new AP. If the station was roaming, the MAC address of the old AP, and the RSSI level prior to roaming, is also provided (for an association, the second address will appear as all-zeros).

brzSA40WlanStatus.name: brzSA40WlanStatus
brzSA40WlanStatus.description: SA-40 trap, indicating a change in the Wireless media conditions. An ON value is sent when the Wireless LAN quality drops below the brzWlanTrapThreashold value. A trap with an OFF value is sent if the quality improves, exceeding the brzWlanTrapThreashold value. The Wireless LAN quality value is also being sent.

brzGeneralSA40.name: brzGeneralSA40
brzGeneralSA40.description: SA-40 general purpose trap, for future trap implementation.

dot11DefaultWEPKey1.name: dot11DefaultWEPKey1
dot11DefaultWEPKey1.description: This attribute indicates the WEP secret key value corresponding to KeyID 1. The WEP secret key is logically WRITE-ONLY. Attempts to read this attribute shall return a string of asterisks (enter exactly 10 Hex-Decimal digits).

dot11DefaultWEPKey2.name: dot11DefaultWEPKey2
dot11DefaultWEPKey2.description: This attribute indicates the WEP secret key value corresponding to KeyID 2. The WEP secret key is logically WRITE-ONLY. Attempts to read this attribute shall return a string of asterisks (enter exactly 10 Hex-Decimal digits).

dot11DefaultWEPKey3.name: dot11DefaultWEPKey3
dot11DefaultWEPKey3.description: This attribute indicates the WEP secret key value corresponding to KeyID 3. The WEP secret key is logically WRITE-ONLY. Attempts to read this attribute shall return a string of asterisks (enter exactly 10 Hex-Decimal digits).

dot11DefaultWEPKey4.name: dot11DefaultWEPKey4
dot11DefaultWEPKey4.description: This attribute indicates the WEP secret key value corresponding to KeyID 4. The WEP secret key is logically WRITE-ONLY. Attempts to read this attribute shall return a string of asterisks (enter exactly 10 Hex-Decimal digits).

dot11Preauthentication.name: dot11Preauthentication
dot11Preauthentication.description: This attribute, when true, enables Preauthentication algorithm.

dot11PrivacyOptionImplemented.name: dot11PrivacyOptionImplemented
dot11PrivacyOptionImplemented.description: This attribute, when true, shall indicate that the 802.11 WEP option is implemented.

dot11PrivacyInvoke.name: dot11PrivacyInvoke
dot11PrivacyInvoke.description: This attribute indicates if a special mechanism is invoked, to protect the Wireless LAN transmissions. The value is one of the following: 1 - Standard WEP, 2 - No Encryption, 20 - Special Encryption (#0), 21 - Special Encryption (#1), 22 - Special Encryption (#2)

dot11WEPDefaultKeyID.name: dot11WEPDefaultKeyID
dot11WEPDefaultKeyID.description: This attribute shall indicate the use of the first, second, third or fourth DefaultWEPKey when set to values of one, two, three or four.

dot11MaxMulticastRate.name: dot11MaxMulticastRate
dot11MaxMulticastRate.description: This attribute indicates the basic rate for multicast frames.

dot11DwellTime.name: dot11DwellTime
dot11DwellTime.description: This attribute indicates the dwell time in Kilo-microsecond Allowed Values for version 5.x.x and higher are between 19..390. For older versions values are between 1 - 3. This attribute is available only in AP's.

dot11RTSThreshold.name: dot11RTSThreshold
dot11RTSThreshold.description: This attribute indicates the number of bytes in an MPDU (frame), above which an RTS/CTS handshake will be performed. Setting this attribute to be larger than the maximum frame size, will prevent the RTS/CTS handshake for frames transmitted by this station.

dot11ShortRetryLimit.name: dot11ShortRetryLimit
dot11ShortRetryLimit.description: This attribute indicates the number of retransmission attempts made, before a failure condition is indicated. Values between 0..20 .

dot11DwellRetryLimit.name: dot11DwellRetryLimit
dot11DwellRetryLimit.description: This attribute indicates the number of retransmission attempts made in several Dwells, before a failure condition is indicated. Values between 0..9 .

dot11FragmentationThreshold.name: dot11FragmentationThreshold
dot11FragmentationThreshold.description: This attribute specifies the current maximum size, in octets, of the MPDU that will be delivered to the PHY. A frame will be broken into fragments if its size exceeds the value of this attribute, after adding MAC header and tailors. The value is one of the following: 1 - 560 octets, 2 - 800 octets, 3 - 1518 octets.

dot11ShortRetryLimitForVoice.name: dot11ShortRetryLimitForVoice
dot11ShortRetryLimitForVoice.description: This attribute indicates the number of retransmission for voice attempts made, before a failure condition is indicated. Values between 0..9 . This option is only for AP's.

dot11DwellRetryLimitForVoice.name: dot11DwellRetryLimitForVoice
dot11DwellRetryLimitForVoice.description: This attribute indicates the number of retransmission for voice attempts made in several Dwells, before a failure condition is indicated. Values between 0..5 . This option is only for AP's.

dot11CurrentStationStatus.name: dot11CurrentStationStatus
dot11CurrentStationStatus.description: This attribute identifies the current Station Wlan status. This attribute is not available in AP's.

dot11TotalNumberOfAssocSinceLastReset.name: dot11TotalNumberOfAssocSinceLastReset
dot11TotalNumberOfAssocSinceLastReset.description: This attribute identifies how many time the device Associated since startup.

dot11manufacturerName.name: dot11manufacturerName
dot11manufacturerName.description: This attribute identifies the manufacturer of the resource.

dot11manufacturerProductName.name: dot11manufacturerProductName
dot11manufacturerProductName.description: This attribute identifies the manufacturer product name of the resource.

dot11manufacturerProductVersion.name: dot11manufacturerProductVersion
dot11manufacturerProductVersion.description: This attribute identifies the manufacturer's product version of the resource.

dot11CurrentRegDomain.name: dot11CurrentRegDomain
dot11CurrentRegDomain.description: This attribute specifies the regularity domain, for the radio operation of this device. This integer contains an 8 bit value, as defined below: 00h - EthAirNet, 10h - USA, 20h - Canada, 30h - Europe, 31h - Spain, 32h - France, 37h - Europe Double Deviation, 38h - Netherlands, 40h - Japan, 41h - Korea, 48h - Israel, 49h - Australia, 60h - Proprietary.

dot11CurrentTxAntenna.name: dot11CurrentTxAntenna
dot11CurrentTxAntenna.description: This attribute specifies the current antenna being used to transmit. The value is one of the following: 0 - Intelligent antennas selection, 1 - Transmitting only with antenna 1, 2 - Transmitting always with antenna 2.

dot11CurrentTxPwrLvl.name: dot11CurrentTxPwrLvl
dot11CurrentTxPwrLvl.description: This attribute specifies the power level, currently being used to transmit data. The value is one of the following: 0 - Low, or 1 - High.

dot11CurrentDwellTime.name: dot11CurrentDwellTime
dot11CurrentDwellTime.description: This attribute specifies the current time, in Kilo-microseconds, that the radio operates on a single channel. The value is from 19 - 390. The same Dwell Time value should be assigned to all the devices within the same Wireless LAN network.

dot11CurrentSet.name: dot11CurrentSet
dot11CurrentSet.description: This attribute represents the current set of patterns that the device is using to determine the hop sequence. The range of values is 1 to 3, and the default is 1.

dot11CurrentPattern.name: dot11CurrentPattern
dot11CurrentPattern.description: This attribute represents the current pattern that the device is using to determine the hop sequence.

dot11MultyRateSupport.name: dot11MultyRateSupport
dot11MultyRateSupport.description: This attribute indicates the multi cast rate support.

dot11MultyRateDecisionWindow.name: dot11MultyRateDecisionWindow
dot11MultyRateDecisionWindow.description: This attribute indicates the multi cast rate decision window size.

dot11WaitforAssociationAddress.name: dot11WaitforAssociationAddress
dot11WaitforAssociationAddress.description: This attribute indicates the station mac-address. 0 - Use mine 1 - Wait for update via Ethernet Available only for Stations.

dot11JapanCallSign.name: dot11JapanCallSign
dot11JapanCallSign.description: This attribute indicates the Japan call sign string. Available only for Japan Standard.

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Fri May 24 16:42:54 2019
